comments.body: I love the realism -  torches don't stay lit forever in real life - but most people enjoy having torches as a cheap, easy-to-use light source for caving. I don't think this would be a popular change :(

I agree that it logically should be in the game, but there's a point in games where realism meets fun and you have to choose which you want.  We need a cheap and easy lighting object, especially when putting down lights is about the only easy way of keeping our worlds from swarming with monsters.  Many players try to avoid using torches as permanent lights because they stand out and are boring, but that doesn't mean that they should stop working on their own.
This shoukd be a good idea, but for hardcore mode not for normal survival.
If they don't want to implement burning out why not implement unlit torches instead? They have done it in campfires. Then just add a datapack or two to workaround implementing burning out.

As the lamp is a recent addition this hits me as a good idea. I know it was an original thought and the idea that one could either recycle the used material or even use some to relight said torches that have burned out is a good one. As well, it could be set as an optional piece in world options. Holding the torch in your off hand as a source of light is a great idea, even using the lamp in this way too. All this along with the idea of recycling the used torches hits me as one that has been delayed far too long.
this would encourage players to upgrade to better lighting like lanterns or redstone lamps. meaning people won't use torches as much, except in caves.
you can use nether rack to make a forever torch

There's history to it, though, because cat and 13 are the two oldest music discs in the game and are part of Volume Alpha, not Volume Beta. 

So...... I like your idea because it would give more color and variety to the game, but at the same time, it's kind of a link to the past. I'd be fine either way.
I would like to get my Blocks Music Disc without having a Skeleton kill a Creeper.
I think the point is that you have to get it from mobs.  And it would be easy enough to turn a zombie spawned into a drowned farm for obtaining tridents.

I for one hate having to rely on the law of large numbers to obtain something as awesome as a trident. I've killed every drowned with a trident I've ever seen, all with my looting sword, and have yet to obtain one. Also, converted Zombie farms don't work (at least in the Java edition) because Drowned will never drop tridents unless they are holding one, and converted Drowned never gain additional equipment.

Yeah, having to grind mobs that rarely show up and create farms to get a specific item is unreliable and unintuitive for a player who might not have the know how/willingness to construct such farms.

However, that crafting recipe is far too cheap for the power of a trident (and also doesn't feel like it wholly represents what a trident is made from)
Something like three nether quartz in the top row, two diamond (or diamond blocks for incredible expense) for the shaft in the middle two slots, flanked by a total of four prismarine shards.
agree, with that craft I could eventually have a chance since it's hard to have them, also would be better if drowned wouldn't had tridents, it's just op, three hits and you're dead

So basically I have an idea first you need to obtain the three blades that are in the tip of the trident you get them by killing all three elder guardians in the sea temples when you have obtained all blades your gonna need to swim to the exact center of the temple and there you will find the handle of the trident stuck in the ground you can only pull it out if you have all three blades but your not finished yet now you have to craft the head you craft the head by placing all the blades at the top in the crafting table at the left and right slots in the middle you add prismarine slabs in the center slot you add heart of the sea and the middle slot on the last row you add prismarine block if you add al that in a crafting table you get the trident head then you put the trident head and handle in crafting table and boom you've got yourself a trident and they do not drop from drowned any more

If anything, tridents should be a reward for beating a monument. Perhaps they should be easier to repair, but they should not be easier to obtain.

P.S. I see a lot of comments on every post basically saying "make the game easier". For those of you thinking this way, please reconsider. The fun of a game comes partly from the challenge. Getting powerful items (like tridents) should be difficult and involved enough that the experience of getting one is exciting and rewarding.
This is my idea for the recipe, though I would prefer it be more like you have to craft three new items(two of them the same actually, to make the pole part) and combine those in order to craft one.
Side note, if you are using pictures for your craft recipe, please keep the images small, and also include a text version of your recipe. Thanks.
I think the two prismarine blocks on the left and the two on the right should be turned into prismarine shards, to make tridents harder to craft.
I think so too but instead of 2 prismarine on top it should be 3 quarts on top

Sorry if I’m approaching this wrong. It’s my first time posting feedback and I did it before I did a thorough search of the existing feedback. I made a post under the mobs section that elder guardians should each drop 1/3 barbs used for crafting a trident. It fits thematically with their thorns attack and implies lore about the origins of the drowned, which is fun. I obviously agree with the OP’s idea of making tridents craftable as this eliminates the need to grind for tridents by killing massive numbers of drowned. Drowned can still drop them, but this provides an alternative. And making the barbs a guaranteed drop of the elder guardians incentivizes beating more than one monument (so you can take advantage of the mutually exclusive enchantments on tridents), while simultaneously rewarding players with a weapon to make beating the next monument a bit easier.
Now that we are in the copper age. I think updating OP's recipe might be in order Two oxidized copper rods for the shaft and 3 Prismarine shards should be sufficient.

I don't really see a point in this, given that Iron is already so easy to get and copper wouldn't serve an important role on the tech tree. It should have some unique ability so that there would be a reason. Perhaps some interaction with redstone?
Good idea but copper is rarer than iron so people would just use iron I think that a special ability like electricity that would shock or electrify the player / mob you're hitting would be awesome
putting something between stone and iron is bad, you can get iron in 3 minutes and personally I think that would make copper a boring ore.

Sinceramente la idea no la veo mala,pero de hecho ya hay muchas cosas que hacer con el cobre: bloque, pararrayos, telescopio, velas, etc..
Así que no creo que hacer herramientas de cobre sea como lo mejor del mundo pero me agrada la idea
it would be good

Interesante idea lo del hacha y el pico de minería, pero buscando en otros comentarios sobre el cobre en ingles (copper), encontré uno de septiembre de 2021, en el cual la persona piensa casi lo mismo que yo había pensado: crear "alambre de cobre", ya sea en bastones (como los palos que sueltan los arboles o crear con 2 de madera) o bloque de alambre, para ahorrar recursos de redstone al energizar ciertos artefactos.
Explico el como se podría hacer el alambre compartiendo la receta de la persona que lo escribió:
* Una barra de cobre + una redstone, podrían crear 4 bastones de alambre o 4 bloques de alambre de cobre.
* Después de crearlos, el jugador podrá usar cera y polvo de color para recubrir dichos bastones o bloques de alambre (1 de cera + 1 polvo de color + 1 de bastón o bloque = bastón o bloque aislado de color) y así poder ser usados bajo el agua o energizar artefactos.
[De aquí en adelante va mi idea de como utilizar lo ideado anteriormente y otras mas para el cobre]
- Para hacer correr la energía por estos bastones o bloques de alambre, solo se necesitara: 1 lamina de presión de hierro + 1 antorcha de redstone + 5 pepita de cobre = interruptor I/O de señal eléctrica.
- El cobre procesado a bastón o bloque de alambre sin recubrir, se podría usar para hacer cercas electrificada para mantener a raya a los zombies y monstruos en general.
- Al igual que la barra de hierro, de la barra de cobre se podrían sacar 9 pepas de cobre.

Y eso es todo por el momento.

I agree, but if it is upgraded from netherite, it inherits all powers like immune to lava from netherite, and has 60% to twice as much durability as diamond. When you break a block or kill a mob, it tps the items to your ender chest if you have space or you could bind it to a new chest that hoppers can pull from. This could be useful if you want what you mined or hunted goes into a mass storage/sorting system. Finally, when you die, any enderite item is directly deposited into a shulker box in your ender chest, but it would deal some damage to your armor/tools.

Texture examples: Purple with ender pearl color lines running throughout, but not as much as in this preview.
Have the enderite armor set give a chance of teleporting you to negate damage that increases with the ammout of pieces, and then you would have a pretty interesting alternative to netherite.
I agree, however the enderite name sounds too similar to netherite, how about a name like enderium?
I agree with the name Enderium. Sounds more mysterious just like the End.
How about Moonstone instead of Enderite? Enderite just sounds like cheaply retextured netherite tbh
I think it can also add an enderium bow
As well as clay blocks and clay items.

Was ist ein Hochofen
Ich kenne nur einen Schmelzofen
Yes!!
I was making an xp farm (its my first one, its kinda bad) that smelted stone, but it could be faster with this mechanic!
im glad someone else has thought the same thing. if this doesnt happen, perhaps a separate "kiln" could help
This is just fun!  It could be the only way to obtain the seeds from the watermelons
I agree with this but I think there should be a one in 2-3 chance you get one. just for the sole purpose that you can get them from just putting it in a crafting window.
Maybe it should just be a chance for that to occur, like a 50% or 20% because in minecraft all seeds are viable and in real life that is about how many melons have usable seeds after eating them.
This is a good idea!It also seems realistic.

Just throwing this out there for anyone that eats melons; melons would become a bit like potions in that they leave something after consumption. As long as the seeds stack with other seeds when you receive them, I love this idea.
I like it. But shouldn’t there be Sea Green dye?
Maybe combining light blue and light green
that would be light blue and neon green daniel
It was originally named spring green.
Also, here's the image from the wiki
Also I think Ultramarine wool should make a return too. Made a post for it and it seems to have gotten rejected.

I agree! I tried to build the gay flag to go in my base, but there isn't any light blue/greenish colored block. The closest I could find was prismarine bricks but that's too close to the waxed oxidized copper color, so it looks weird! So I think there should be Seafoam green blocks.
Sounds cool what if they gave us ten seconds of fire resistance
I'm thinking that's way to overpowered but I think a temporary effect like the turtle helmit has would be pretty awesome!
Great idea!

First of all, your face is not covered, so it wouldn't make any sense.

And, it would make potions of fire resistance useless.
Yes it would get rid of fire resistance, but on the other hand it would take ages to get full netherite armour.
And also this is minecraft not everything is realistic.
Yeah this is good, it'd be like a set bonus when you wear all of it.

393696808612 I made an idea earlier about a Netherite Turtle Helmet that basically does the same thing as you idea for Netherite Amour! I love the Idea about Netherite Amour, but in the end it would get rid of the benefits of fire resistance and would hurt other game mechanics.

It doesn't take "ages" to get a full Netherite set.

 

393971381591 30 seconds is too much, even 10 seconds sounds OP.
I think that it shouldn’t remove all fire damage. A full set of Netherite armor should make you a total of 60% or 50% fire resistant

But first of all it takes at least 3 stacks of tnt to find a few antient debris and you still have to deal with lava veins flowing over you and not to mention you need 4 antient debris (and 4 gold ) to make 1 bar
I think that will make the game unbalance because then Fire Protection will be useless.
ShinokuMiyah good point with the helmet not covering your face. Maybe it guides you the ability to wade in lava (holding spacebar to stay above the surface) but doesn’t protect you if you submerge.
그러면 촣을것 같아용!!
Slime Blocks* lmao
Yeah. I agree. In pots, they will look like snowberries in Skyirm Special Edition!

I like the premise of the idea. But I personally think that it might be a bit to much. Maybe a symbol or something on the book to let you know what it does. And books with multiple enchants can be openable like a book and quill and each page has a symbol for what the enchants are. possible along with the name of the enchant.
Love the idea. I would adore to see this in game.

I have dyslexia and this would be very helpful especially when I was younger and if they are going to change the ores for color blind people they should add symbols as well and maybe replace the Roman numerals with numbers

Love the idea! Great for accessibility and just general navigation!

Here are my ideas:

  • Aqua Affinity: Pickaxe with bubbles around it
  • Bane of Arthropods: Spider
  • Blast Protection: Armor with different coloration of explosion behind it
  • Channeling: Trident with lightning
  • Curse of Binding: Chain
  • Cure of Vanishing: Poof of smoke
  • Depth Strider: Dolphin
  • Efficiency: Pickaxe with air marks
  • Feather Falling: Feather
  • Fire Aspect: Blazing sword
  • Fire Protection: Chestplate of fire
  • Flaming: Arrow on fire
  • Fortune: Clover
  • Frostwalker: Snowflake
  • Infinity: Infinity symbol around arrow
  • Impaling: Trident soaring through water
  • Looting: Multiple diamonds
  • Loyalty: Collar with charm
  • Lure: Worm on fishing rod
  • Mending: Sword with experience particles around it
  • Multishot: Three arrows in one bow
  • Piercing: Arrow going through a target
  • Power: Effects around a arrow
  • Projectile Protection: Armor with arrows bouncing off it
  • Protection: Shield in style of the armor bar
  • Respiration: Bubbles
  • Riptide: Bubbles on thrown trident
  • Silk Touch: Pickaxe with silk ribbon
  • Smite: Zombie head
  • Sould Speed: Soul
  • Sweeping Edge: Sword with slash marks on both sides
  • Swift Sneak: Swirl sorta symbol thing
  • Thorns: Rose with thorns or armor with thorn vines around it
  • Quick Charge: Air marks around charged bow
  • Unbreaking: Sword with swirling effect around it
is very neccesary hopefully it will be added

Moved to proper category.

Clarified subject to help search results.

Thanks for your contribution.
That would be pretty cool actually. Love the idea

ABSOLUTELY! I dream of glowstone slabs, sealantern slabs lit quartz panels (slab) redstone lamp slabs, new colors for sea lanterns that still give the same light. We can't ask for furniture so I can't think what besides lanterns you could do but any of the other items I mentioned would be welcome. Need some options for those of us that like to do modern buildings.
I don't want to offend anyone, but lanterns already exist.
Instead of just putting the bark back on you should have to craft the stripped log with the bark and a slime ball.

please, minecraft... I build houses with a large majority of logs, Im usually holding an axe and I've gotta keep spare logs in my inventory at all times because I keep missclicking doors,chests, etc.

I often fight with axes these days since swords Sweep Attack keep damaging entities I don't want to hurt. (Sweep Attack, though, is being made optional soon so that's nice)

This sounds like a good idea. Accidentally stripping logs is super irritating!

I'm also a player who used to prefer having an axe in hand, but had to change my play style to prevent unintentional stripped logs. A simple way to un-strip a log would be a welcome addition.

With simplicity in mind, do not make it a crafting recipe (especially not with slime), and having multiple bark types also seems counter-productive. It should be a simple matter of, oops, then picking up the bark item and right-clicking back into place.

Although honestly, I think it was a terrible idea to make an axe the default tool for stripping. I've been annoyed with this since it was implemented (and I'm not alone). If a different tool was used, like shears, it would be much less of a problem (I doubt many players walk around with shears in hand).

I've been trying to figure out how the change the default stripping behavior with a data pack, but the solution has eluded me.
Honeycomb is used to prevent copper from ageing, maybe honeycomb could also be used on logs to prevent them from being stripped.
This already works in java edition and should be ported
That makes sense. Buckets aren't really expensive though.
Yea cuz i commonly need loads of water yet dont want to / cant afford to waste so much iron..
Also should be able to hold milk like in real life!
i Like this Idea! i Rarely get Any iron without using commands.
You should also be able to carry multiple buckets of water because they are less heavy than iron. It would make dealing with water in survival a lot easier.

To help preserve balance - perhaps they also leak.

At each "Random Tick Time" a full bucket has a small chance of becoming empty.
Quite historically accurate technology. It may have copper rims.

Given the relative scarcity of iron in many games and the hyper-realistic efforts of real world simulation, wooden buckets to hold water and milk with limited durability, and a random tick percent chance of spontaneous leaks feels like they are missing from the game.
This, just like flying Minecarts is also another thing I would love for you to implement into the game.
I need this! I want to build a large train network, but it's a shame minecarts are only a bit faster than walking.
Maybe you could combine prismarine shards and iron stuff on a smithing table for new armor and weapons
It should spawn under ocean biomes, giving you a reason to explore the flooded caves.
I made a mistake since a TNT block actually has 16 sticks instead of 9. My bad.

To get dynamite, you should craft a block of TNT surrounded by sticks, and only get one. It's kinda cheating the system by getting 9 explosions for one. (I also personally think it should be called a Stick O' Dynamite.) When this item is selected in your hotbar, right-clicking it once should light it, and right-clicking again. It can't blow up in your hand, but once thrown, it should explode on impact with a block or entity. For added coolness, it should have a forward spinning motion.
good

Bananas should grow in banana trees, which could be found near beaches. They could be fed to monkeys, which would be a new mob that could be added to the game. If monkeys don't get added, that's fine, because I really love the idea of just having bananas and banana cream pie!

Crafting recipe?  Appearance?  Amount of damage dealt?  You said that they should add shurikens, but did not describe them in the slightest.  In fact, you could be suggesting that we be able to throw motorcycles (a shuriken is a type of motorcycle) at other entities.
I fixed it Bilbo, howzit now?
Dude this must be in game. It's to cool not to be in game! Voted!
There does need to be away to save the enchantments on the weapons so then the player can't waste them.

There should also be enchantments made only for the Shurikens. I came up with suggestions:

 

Bonfire: Will ignite the target on fire

Jagged Edge: Will increase the weapons damage

Celerity: Increases the throwing speed

What do you think?
Since the weapon can be thrown it should do more damage then using it for melee. Maybe a 0.7 difference?
It could gain the loyalty enchantment but only have a chance of returning

They are a bit low power to be made of iron; it seems like you could achieve the same effect (though it's not as cool) with throwable stones. Nonetheless, this is a great idea for the players who have trouble quickly switching between melee and ranged, and it's nice to have something craftable that can achieve that. Perhaps throwing spears or an atlatl could achive the same effect with less recourse cost? Perhaps there could be an option to throw 8 of them at a time while crouching with a chargeup time?

Shurikens sound AWESOME!!! How about a new enchantment for shurikens too - it would be called boomerang, and it would bring the shuriken back to your inventory! Or you could make the multishot enchantment apply with shurikens, and it would make one shuriken shoot five shurikens
i like it i think that'd be fun to pull as a prank on your friends but i don't have friends
I'm sorry man this is only suitable for a mod never going to be in game.
A rock bow would be durable and powerful (if you could bend it), but not accurate at all.  I do not see any sense in a rock bow.
This is a website for reasonable ideas and not ones that are too modded related. I'm just gonna get to the point, this makes no sense.

With the Nether update and the addition of Netherite upgrading, bows are feeling left out.
I can understand not having iron bows, or diamond bows, or whatnot, but Netherite actually makes sense.
One of the big reasons to upgrade your armor, weapons, and tools is because Netherite makes them inflammable, therefore they're not destroyed by lava.
If you die, you can retrieve all you gear…except your bow, which burned in the fires.
I know the bow is made of sticks and string, but a sword uses sticks too! Every tool does. And crafting a solid suit of armor from diamonds never made any sense anyway.
I feel like bows, crossbows, perhaps even fishing poles (considering the importance of Striders) should be Netherite-compatible.

Mesmo desafiando às leis da gravidade como outros disseram, eu acho que um funil que leva os itens para cima seria algo muito útil e que ajudaria bastante nas construções de farmes e outros sistemas de redstone. Espero ver isso no minecraft um dia.
